title: Supply services, Service for hygiene of premises and equipment in UMC Ljubljana

author: Anica Škraba Škrabl, Univerzitetni Klinični Center Ljubljana

segmentation: Good afternoon, I monitor Scrabble Scrabble.
I'm from the University Clinical Center in Ljubljana and I will represent you the supply services and the service of hygiene of premises and equipment in our hospital.
Approximately, we have 650 employees ahead of supply services leaders within that Department and also team leaders.
In the hour, employees are nurses, sanitary engineers, hospital attendants, servers, telephone operators, housekeepers suppliers, informers and so on.
You can see here our department's, so there's a head Department.
The service of hygiene and premises and equipment supply services for hospital line and central career into refreshment service, central sterilization, patient escort Sir.
Office and General information service.
Um?
We clean approximately 60% of our surface is by ourselves 10% of the cleaning.
Do the departments by themselves and 30% are outsourced.
So we have cleaning institutions.
They clean the surface is for us.
In our Department we have about 300 employees.
Mrs Chalk couldn't be here today she is the head of our Department and also there are 11 sanitary engineers to sanitary techniques to administrators in about 270 housekeepers.
We are present seven days a week, so from Monday to Sunday Holidays there is no.
Um?
No answer, we have different shifts.
Our housekeepers are the most in two shifts.
To clean and in some critical areas there are also by night, so we have a 24 hour housekeeper service serving.
What's our work to organize the daily work process?
Internal and external cleaning controls control with ATP swaps.
Make Glow check method controls.
We are sold to contaminate some areas.
Patient rooms, intensive care units, operating rooms and so on.
Educate our employees.
We have also four different bed.
Stations where we.
Clean the equipment so there's also a control of that part in disinsection and pest control.
Of course, in the hospital there are different risk zones, so we have the operating rooms.
There are the most critical rooms.
With the really really high risk zone, then rooms with only high risks.
They're also were made invasive procedures, room with incread risk like intensive care rooms and other rooms so.
Hospital rooms for our patients.
Here you can see.
An operating room after the cleaning of our housekeepers.
Before there there was an.
Operation and here on the right side the surgical thing so you can see everything is on the place.
Everything was cleaned and prepared for the next procedure.
Here is an in Canon intensive care unit room.
The marks on the picture shows you the critical points the critical points to spread and healthcare infection.

The download points like the bed.
And everything under this area were cleaned by our housekeepers and we have to control how.
How do they clean it?
Is it good or can something spread out of that area?
Here you can see the dailing daily cleaning.
A card solutions and how to clean normally patient room on the left you can see a prepared card.
For one shift, so everything has to be prepared by color by solutions.
Mops everything.
Our housekeeper needs has to be prepared in the morning fresh.
Also this infections.
So she can start with the work on the right side you can see different waves, different solutions we try to connect the colors of the waps with the color of the solution so they are.
They couldn't make a wrong choice to use around wrong solution to clean a surface.
Downstairs you can see a room of a patient.
How to clean it always.
They should clean it from the cleanest area to the UN cleanest area.
ATP control with ATP swaps.
ATP is adenosine triphosphate it Somalia.
It's always present in organic residues so it's a beautiful marker for.
Organic pollutions we.
We make it once a month.
Our housekeepers have three points that we look for so there are door handles, light switches, and.
No.
And things that are the critical points.
So we use to swab it every month, three points and not only our housekeepers.
Also the nurses were controlled by 4 points, 4 critical points.
Also with this ATP swaps.
Here you can see a result.
The results become in a report.
Um, four to four to six times a year.
So the head nurse of the Department can see.
What are the results?
How do the nurses clean their surface is and what are our housekeepers doing?
So we get also the reports if one ATP swap fails.
We have to educate the worker at the place and reach retest the same surface so we can show what cleaning can do.
On the surface.
Also we make Glow check control.
It's unannounced on predetermined Marks and a minimal result of 70% has to be.
Procedure.
There must be at least 70% of the result, otherwise we have to eradicate our housekeepers and repeat the procedure.
Also, we make aerosol the contaminations we use it since August 213.
In this moment we have three machines in use.
We regularly the contaminate intensive care unit.
You operating rooms clinicals and hospital rooms, but not every day and not every time.
Only if there was an intent.
Hospital infection, an isolation room or if in bed in a patient room was a patient over 20 days with an infection.
So then we did that contaminated with.
Aerosonic the contamination.
It works on orthophosphoric acid, hydrogen peroxide, silver caitians and deionized water.
The liquid gets vaporized into a very fine mist, and reach is also very hard to reachable places.
Here you can see my colleague which places the aerosolized contamination machine into our pre prepared room and a hammer to logical.
Department.
Education Education is a very very important area for us and every housekeeper or every worker must be special educated before before he starts to work.
Also we periodical renewal on education and daily on the job.
When we see any problems.
We also re educate our.
Our staff.
Special education's.

Before the beginning of the work, fire, safety, separation and Waste management, hospital infections, transmission, infection and diseases and personal safety equipment are a very higher Kristen education.
Periodically renewed education, how to work and how to handle with machines and other work equipment.
Proper handling of chemicals.
Proper use of personal protective equipment in Cave of Hamill, hemorrhagic fevers, proper cleaning, proper washing and as infections of hands.
Proper use, equipment and removal of personal protective equipment in hospital infections.
Proper use of cleaning and disinfection agents.
Proper handling and waste disposal.
Importancy of vaccinations.
In seminars of.
Different areas.
Um?
When we are in our department's we look how our staff is working.
So when we see anything is going wrong, we have to educate them right there.
There also after a retest with the ATP swaps after a poor glow check result.
So there's a lot to do.
People forget things, people.
Do it.
Quicker and we have to look after them so we can have our surface is clean.
Like I told we have a bad stations.
We have four bet stations.
There are two different ways we ways of cleaning our beds and the equipment by the housekeepers within the department's Orinda Bed station.
There is a program how the beds are come from the areas into the bed stations and how the clean.
A bit come back to the areas to the to the areas to to use them again.
The Dirty items are stored in the unclean part of our bed station.
So in the morning it fills up.
Through the day they will be cleaned and go up to the areas again.
Here can you see?
So how is a bet prepared to disinfect so everytime bed is going to be cleaned, it's always from the cleanest to the UN cleanest zone?
In the bed station is always 15 minutes given to the infections, so they be disinfected.
Other equipment which is cleaned in the bed station.
There are some transport cards beside lockers, cushions and also termed as infection of other equipment.
The clean, the cleaned beds and lockers are stored in the clean area of the bed station.
They will they are covered with plastic foil and get tagged with the green tag.
They are clean so every area knows it is.
It is a clean bed so they can use it again for a new patient.
The best station works six days a week, but.
If an area needed a fresh, clean bed so they can get it because there's always someone here to get them a clean bed from the bed station.
At least disinsection and pest control.
We also organize this area, but we don't do it by ourselves, so the areas call us if they have any problems.
We organize the disinsection or the pest control and.
It is done then.
Thank you very much for your time.
